document_title: Influenza A H5N1: Symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: cum-a-h5n1.json_4_Stages of development of influenza A H5N1
subsection_content:
Influenza A H5N1 has 3 stages of development:
First is the incubation period, with no signs. Influenza virus can hide in the body for 2-8 days, but can also last up to 17 days after the patient is exposed to pathogenic factors.; Next is the disease onset stage. At this time, infected people gradually appear symptoms such as high fever, dry cough, body aches, loss of appetite,...; Finally, the disease enters its full-blown stage. Symptoms of influenza A H5N1 gradually become clearer and more severe. The patient may fall into a coma, lose consciousness, have headaches, eye socket pain or severe lumbar pain. If you do not receive proper medical care early, the condition will become more difficult to control.
